faq.title: CPC Calculator FAQ
faq.description: Common questions about Cost Per Click calculations and PPC advertising

items.title: What is Cost Per Click (CPC)?
items.description: CPC is the amount you pay for each click on your advertisement in pay-per-click (PPC) advertising campaigns.

items.title: How is CPC calculated?
items.description: CPC is calculated by dividing the total cost of your ads by the number of clicks received. Formula: CPC = Total Cost / Number of Clicks

items.title: What's a good CPC rate?
items.description: A good CPC varies by industry and keywords. Generally, lower CPC with high conversion rates indicates better campaign performance.

items.title: How can I reduce my CPC?
items.description: Improve your Quality Score, use long-tail keywords, optimize ad relevance, and refine your targeting to reduce CPC costs.

items.title: What's the difference between CPC and CPM?
items.description: CPC charges per click while CPM charges per thousand impressions. CPC is better for performance campaigns, CPM for brand awareness.
